search.ai_prompt: Based on these search results, answer the question "{{prompt}}" clearly and helpfully:

create_file.missing_path: âŒ I need the file path. E.g.: "create file test.txt with hello world"

execute.missing_command: âŒ I need the command. E.g.: "run npm --version"

run_script.missing_path: âŒ I need the script path. E.g.: "run script build.js"

open_app.missing: âŒ Which application should I open? E.g.: "open notepad" or "open chrome"

open_url.missing: âŒ Which site should I open? E.g.: "open site google.com"

kill_process.missing: âŒ Which process should I terminate? E.g.: "kill process notepad" or "kill 1234"

focus_window.missing: âŒ Which window should I focus? E.g.: "focus chrome window"

window_action.missing: âŒ Which window? E.g.: "minimize chrome" or "close notepad"

type.missing: âŒ What text should I type? E.g.: "type hello world"

shortcut.missing: âŒ Which shortcut? E.g.: "shortcut ctrl+c" or "press ctrl+v"

key.missing: âŒ Which key? E.g.: "press enter" or "key tab 3 times"

move.missing: âŒ I need the coordinates. E.g.: "move cursor to 500, 300"

copy.missing: âŒ What text to copy? E.g.: "copy this text"

setup.catalog_header:
ğŸ”Œ **Configure Custom AI Provider**

ğŸ“‹ **Available providers:**
setup.instructions:
ğŸ’¡ **How to configure:**
```
setup openai with sk-proj-abc123...
```
```
configure anthropic with sk-ant-abc123...
```
```
use mistral with key abc123...
```
setup.need_key: ğŸ”‘ You need the API key from the provider you've subscribed to.
setup.usage_info:
From now on, all your conversations will use **{{name}}**.
If the API fails, Groq will be used as automatic backup.
setup.useful_commands:
ğŸ’¡ Useful commands:
â€¢ "my provider status" â€” view configuration
â€¢ "change model to gpt-4o" â€” switch model
â€¢ "remove my provider" â€” go back to Groq
â€¢ "disable my provider" â€” temporarily pause

remove.success:
ğŸ—‘ï¸ **Provider removed successfully!**

The provider "{{name}}" has been deconfigured.
From now on, all conversations will use **Groq** (free).

ğŸ’¡ You can reconfigure at any time with "setup [provider] with [api-key]".
remove.no_provider: âŒ No provider configured to remove.

status.no_provider:
ğŸ“Š **AI Provider Status**

âŒ No custom provider configured.
You are using **Groq** (free) as the default provider.

ğŸ’¡ To configure a paid provider: "setup [provider] with [api-key]"
ğŸ“‹ To see options: "list AI providers"
status.active_msg:
âœ¨ Your messages are processed by your paid provider.
If it fails, Groq is used as automatic backup.
status.inactive_msg:
â¸ï¸ Your provider is **disabled**. Messages use Groq.
Say "enable my provider" to reactivate.
status.commands:
ğŸ’¡ Commands:
â€¢ "change model to [model]"
â€¢ "disable/enable my provider"
â€¢ "remove my provider"

toggle.enabled:
â–¶ï¸ **Provider reactivated!**

"{{name}}" is now **active**. Your messages will be processed by it.
toggle.disabled:
â¸ï¸ **Provider disabled.**

"{{name}}" is now **paused**. Messages will use Groq (free).

Say "enable my provider" to reactivate.

model.changed:
ğŸ¤– **Model changed!**

Model: **{{model}}**
Provider: {{provider}}

Your next messages will use this model.
model.provider_not_found: âŒ Provider not found in catalog.
model.no_provider: âŒ No provider configured. Configure first with "setup [provider] with [api-key]".

provider.onboarding:
ğŸ”Œ **Premium AI Integration**

Did you know you can use your own AI provider?

ğŸ†“ **Current:** Groq (free, LLaMA 3.3 70B)
ğŸ’ **Premium:** OpenAI, Claude, Mistral, DeepSeek, xAI and more!

**Why?**
âœ¨ More advanced models (GPT-4o, Claude 3.5, etc.)
ğŸ“Š No rate limits
ğŸ”’ Your own account and control

**How to configure:**
Say: "setup [provider] with [api-key]"
Example: "setup openai with sk-proj-abc123..."

Groq stays as free backup!
